merge_operations.reason: Same project (EcoBloom summer campaign). Combines kickoff/scheduling with final design handoff to create a coherent pre-legal deliverables thread under 25 messages.
Same project (EcoBloom). Groups client feedback/revisions with the final legal approval flow to keep the end-of-project activities together and under 25 messages.
Same project (TechNova). Merges kickoff/milestones with the budget kickoff/coordination thread to keep early planning in one place while keeping message count <=25.

split_operations.reason: Two distinct subthreads: final design wrap-up vs. legal approval; splitting enables cleaner EcoBloom phase grouping and balanced sizes for downstream merges.

split_operations.reason: Too large (>25). Natural division between budget kickoff/coordination and detailed line-item development/approvals.

suggested_splits.title: TechNova Budget Kickoff and Inputs Coordination

split_operations.reason: Too large (>25). Two clear phases: evaluating the extension request and planning/communicating the revised timeline.

suggested_splits.title: GreenScape Extension Request: Evaluation and Team Inputs
GreenScape Revised Timeline Planning and Confirmation

ai_operations.reasoning: Goal was 12–15 final clusters while applying rules: merge when same project and semantically related; split when multiple topics or >25 messages. Two clusters exceeded the size threshold (TechNova budget at 31; GreenScape extension at 29), so they were split along natural phase boundaries. To offset the added clusters and keep within target, EcoBloom’s three phase-based clusters (kickoff, revisions, finalization) were reorganized: split finalization into a design handoff thread and a legal approval thread, then merged each with the most semantically aligned phase (kickoff with design wrap-up; revisions with legal approval). Additionally, TechNova’s kickoff cluster was merged with a small budget kickoff/coordination split to keep early planning consolidated and under 25 messages. Other potential merges (e.g., FitFusion, GreenScape, UrbanEdge) would have exceeded 25 messages and required further splits without reducing the total cluster count, so they were left intact.
